body.p:
To hi Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Thomas Jeffrerey would respectfully state that one Wm Clark Cla was held & confined in the Jail of Jefferson county on a charge of felony in default of bail in the Sum of four hundred dollars $400 Your petitioner became the bail of said Clark; & Judgment for four hundred dollars was given at the Sept Term of the Jefferson Circuit Court.

Your petitioner was induced to bail said Clark from the fact of his bieing a soldier in the company to which his nephew belonged. In fact it was done on the representations of his Nephew; he gave him an excelent character as a Soldier and a man.

Your petitioner is a working man & went upon the bond without bieing indemnified. he is unable to pay the judgment
without feeling great distress.
Your Excellency is respectfully refered to the signers who unite in the prayre for a remission of the judgment.
Your petitioner requests Your Excellency to remit the amount & he will ever pray &c
We the undersigned respectfully request that Your Excellency remit the Judgment against Thomas Jeffrey

J R Dupuy
comm' atty
Geo. W. Johnston
ct Judge
W. A. Ronald S J C
James P. Chambers

Jefferson Cir. Ct
Thos Jeffry
$300,
Forfeiture 6 Sept /65
